Multiple Raptors against the launchpad will create supersonic updrafts between engines. This will increase the debris quantity and size and velocity of debris impacting the engines. And what’s more, the circular pattern of updrafts turning sideways and being drawn back down pulled by the exhaust will make that debris hit the engines from crazy side angles.
Now increase the debris damage problem by 794 times on top of that. Debris from each of 28 raptors have 28 chances to damage each of the 28 engines. 28 times 28 or 794 times more likely for damage compared to a single engine test. And the static fire test is only a fraction of the time compared to a launch. Bottom line is any launch debris in a superheavy launch is unacceptable and can easily make the whole rocket blowup on the launch pad.

This is the last remaining frontier of our civilization. Elon and co., working on Starship. Yes, there are some 7 billion other humans, mostly involved in trying to scr3w one another in different ways, most just struggling to survive another day. Some are trying to destroy others, some are scheming, lobbying, trying to get power over others via "financial instruments", making money out of bits. We do not fully understand how this might be THE bottleneck. There was a time in history, where human population decreased to mere 3.000-10.000 people. An then they bravely decided to move out and take risks to spread around the world. It might have been a decision of a single individual that decided the fate of us all. And perhaps even the fate of our Galaxy, if all really goes well.
